member.name: M:ServiceStack.Auth.AuthHttpGateway.DownloadYammerUserInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Download Yammer User Info given its ID.
member.returns: The User info in JSON format.

remarks.para: Yammer provides a method to retrieve current user information via "https://www.yammer.com/api/v1/users/current.json".
However, to ensure consistency with the rest of the Auth codebase, the explicit URL will be used, where [:id] denotes the User ID: "https://www.yammer.com/api/v1/users/[:id].json"
Refer to: https://developer.yammer.com/restapi/ for full documentation.

member.name: T:ServiceStack.Auth.YammerAuthProvider
member.summary: The ServiceStack Yammer OAuth provider.

remarks.para: This provider is loosely based on the existing ServiceStack's Facebook OAuth provider.
For the full info on Yammer's OAuth2 authentication flow, refer to: https://developer.yammer.com/authentication/#a-oauth2

Note: Add these to your application / web config settings under appSettings and replace values as appropriate.
<!-- ServiceStack Yammer OAuth config --> <add key="oauth.yammer.ClientId" value=""/> <add key="oauth.yammer.ClientSecret" value=""/> <add key="oauth.yammer.AccessTokenUrl" value="https://www.yammer.com/oauth2/access_token.json"/> <add key="oauth.yammer.CallbackUrl" value="~/"/> <add key="oauth.yammer.PreAuthUrl" value="https://www.yammer.com/dialog/oauth"/> <add key="oauth.yammer.Realm" value="https://www.yammer.com"/> <add key="oauth.yammer.RedirectUrl" value="~/auth/yammer"/>

member.name: T:ServiceStack.FluentValidation.Validators.ScalePrecisionValidator
member.summary:
Allows a decimal to be validated for scale and precision. Scale would be the number of digits to the right of the decimal point. Precision would be the number of digits.
It can be configured to use the effective scale and precision (i.e. ignore trailing zeros) if required.
123.4500 has an scale of 4 and a precision of 7, but an effective scale and precision of 2 and 5 respectively.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.HostConfig.UseSaltedHash
member.summary:
If enabled reverts to persist password hashes using the original SHA256 SaltedHash implementation. By default ServiceStack uses the more secure ASP.NET Identity v3 PBKDF2 with HMAC-SHA256 implementation.
New Users will have their passwords persisted with the specified implementation, likewise existing users will have their passwords re-hased to use the current registered IPasswordHasher.

member.name: P:ServiceStack.HostConfig.FallbackPasswordHashers
member.summary: Older Password Hashers that were previously used to hash passwords. Failed password matches check to see if the password was hashed with any of the registered FallbackPasswordHashers, if true the password attempt will succeed and password will get re-hashed with the current registered IPasswordHasher.

member.name: T:ServiceStack.SuppressFormsAuthenticationRedirectModule
member.summary:
This class interecepts 401 requests and changes them to 402 errors. When this happens the FormAuthentication module will no longer hijack it and redirect back to login because it is a 402 error, not a 401. When the request ends, this class sets the status code back to 401 and everything works as it should.
PathToSupress is the path inside your website where the above swap should happen.
If you can build for .net 4.5, you do not have to do this swap. You can take advantage of a new flag (SuppressFormsAuthenticationRedirect) that tells the FormAuthenticationModule to not redirect, which also means you will not need the EndRequest code.

member.name: T:Funq.IFluentInterface
member.summary: Helper interface used to hide the base members from the fluent API to make for much cleaner Visual Studio intellisense experience.

member.name: T:Funq.IFunqlet
member.summary: Funqlets are a set of components provided as a package to an existing container (like a module).

member.name: M:Funq.IFunqlet.Configure(Funq.Container)
member.summary: Configure the given container with the registrations provided by the funqlet.

member.name: T:Funq.IContainerModule
member.summary: Interface used by plugins to contribute registrations to an existing container.

member.name: T:Funq.Owner
member.summary: Determines who is responsible for disposing instances registered with a container.

member.name: F:Funq.Owner.Container
member.summary: Container should dispose provided instances when it is disposed. This is the default.

member.name: F:Funq.Owner.External
member.summary: Container does not dispose provided instances.

member.name: F:Funq.Owner.Default
member.summary: Default owner, which equals .

member.name: T:Funq.ResolutionException
member.summary: Exception thrown by the container when a service cannot be resolved.

member.name: M:Funq.ResolutionException.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes the exception with the service that could not be resolved.

member.name: M:Funq.ResolutionException.#ctor(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the exception with the service (and its name) that could not be resolved.

member.name: M:Funq.ResolutionException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the exception with an arbitrary message.

member.name: T:Funq.ReuseScope
member.summary: Determines visibility and reuse of instances provided by the container.

member.name: F:Funq.ReuseScope.Hierarchy
member.summary: Instances are reused within a container hierarchy. Instances are created (if necessary) in the container where the registration was performed, and are reused by all descendent containers.

member.name: F:Funq.ReuseScope.Container
member.summary: Instances are reused only at the given container. Descendent containers do not reuse parent container instances and get a new instance at their level.

member.name: F:Funq.ReuseScope.None
member.summary: Each request to resolve the dependency will result in a new instance being returned.

member.name: F:Funq.ReuseScope.Request
member.summary: Instaces are reused within the given request

member.name: F:Funq.ReuseScope.Default
member.summary: Default scope, which equals .

member.name: F:Funq.ServiceEntry.Owner
member.summary: Ownership setting for the service.

member.name: F:Funq.ServiceEntry.Reuse
member.summary: Reuse scope setting for the service.

member.name: F:Funq.ServiceEntry.Container
member.summary: The container where the entry was registered.

member.name: M:Funq.ServiceEntry.OwnedBy(Funq.Owner)
member.summary: Specifies the owner for instances, which determines how they will be disposed.

member.name: M:Funq.ServiceEntry.ReusedWithin(Funq.ReuseScope)
member.summary: Specifies the scope for instances, which determines visibility of instances across containers and hierarchies.
